website_summaries.verdict: Numerous adjustments to underarm height and arm/wrist length make these crutches very comfortable. Design discourages painful kinking of the wrists. Many improvements over traditional underarm crutches.
pros: Spring-powered shock absorbers provide positive rebound energy
Ergonomic handles keep wrists in natural position
cons: Handles can become loose over time
Don't address underarm pressure issue common with static crutches

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: SHIPPING MARVELOUS ✝️😁🌲 I have bought several of these crutches different pairs, I originally started out with DON JOY which were much better quality much more comfort the handle grips on these the rubber has a sticky feel to it, kind of like tire rubber is better than the rubber that's on these very,the DonJoys were nice smooth shiney rubber,these very uncomfortable and very squeaky they make a lot of noise the spring is not good, when it was Donjoy,upon opening box the crutches were in used condition SOLD AS NEW. I'm returning them
customer_reviews.author: Kimber

customer_reviews.title: Same as regular crutches
customer_reviews.text: They work just the same as twenty dollar regular old crutches. They look way cooler though
customer_reviews.author: s

customer_reviews.title: Quality well designed product.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, well designed and easily adjustable. My neighbor saw these and ordered a set to replace the crutches he was using.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Haus

customer_reviews.title: Love To Return This!!
customer_reviews.text: Originally this product was a real save. My husband shoulder was very sore & his hands were blistered with the old style crutches. So we ordered a few different crutches from Amazon and kept this crutch. However after using it for Just five weeks it developed this VERY loud squeak (see video attached). I have called the company but can only get voicemail. I asked for a return phone call three days ago. They finally left a message telling us to use chapstick which DID NOT WORK! Summary is the crutches are awesome, however buy a different brand because of the loud squeak that we can’t get rid of. 😡😡😡😡👎
customer_reviews.author: K Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Hate the spring loaded tips.
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, the crutches are fine, but I hate, hate, hate the spring loaded tips. They tend to drag and get hung up on carpet and I am afraid it is only a matter of time before they trip me up and cause a fall. I really don't see the advantages of the springs at all.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy K. Crimmins

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic crutches, especially for a tall person, covered by insurance
customer_reviews.text: These crutches are great. They adjustded perfectly for my height (6'6"/199cm). For a while I needed both crutches, but when I was able to transition to one it worked fine. The spring loaded foot was a huge benefit, especially when going up and down stairs. I also want to commend their customer service. They were able to provide me with all the necessary details to get insurance reimbursement (Blue Shield covered these in full!) even during the most severe Covid lockdowns. They also have replaced the rubber feet when they wore out. Again, I can't recommend this product enough.
customer_reviews.author: J. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful alternative to traditional crutches!
customer_reviews.text: I recently broke my leg, slipping and falling on the ice this past winter. The crutches I was given at the hospital were awful to say the least. I'm 6'3", 225 and I could barely fit my hands inside the crutches on the handles. I was very sore in my hands, shoulders and armpits after only a couple of days. The In-Motion Pro Ergonomic Foldable Crutches were a Godsend. They were comfortable, very stable, especially on slippery or uneven terrain. Highly recommended, just buy them and be done with it!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Boy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product. But, not for anyone with balance/stability challenges
customer_reviews.text: If been using these crutches for about two month. Broke both my Tibia and Fibula in my right leg. Was using traditional crutches, walkers, and wheel chairs for the first few weeks. I was in rehab until I could do up and down stairs with no railings like my house. First time I used these crutches going down stairs it was a bit scary because the shock absorbers in the tips created instability when in a very vulnerable position. After just and hour or two of practice I got used to them. There is no comparison to standard crutches.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E Haley

customer_reviews.title: Quality and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I like the pivot bottoms & the spring action it has.. But, the handle grips bruise my palms. I ABSOLUTELY hate the underpit part you need to use(as like regular crutches) there is NO padding, it's a very very thin foam. I've bruised my underpits so many times I quit using them. That's a whole lotta lotta$$ wasted. Unless you have alot of skin, fat, muscle ( which I don't as being I'm disabled & underweight) it's going to hurt when you use them. I'm supposed to be on crutches ANY TIME I walk & these were a big disappointment...
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding by a expert of being on crutches for thirty years
customer_reviews.text: I have been on crutches as a amputee for thirty years and these are the best crutches on the market . I was concerned about the handles however what I was seeing was explained to me by Oz with the manufacturer and made prefect sinse. Naturally only time will tell but now you can not go wrong. The quick response was as important to me as the item. Attt
customer_reviews.author: Brad Redding

customer_reviews.title: WORTH EVERY PENNY!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing crutches. They are very comfortable & easy to use & put together. Easily adjustable to fit you perfectly. They come with paperbook on how to assemble & adjust correctly to fit you. They come really pretty much put together already. Worth every penny!!! Glad I took the chance and purchased these. I read up thoroughly on what I needed. Lower back and hip issues require crutches. I was going to get elbow crutches but they are based more on foot or leg issues. Not back. Very happy with my purchase & they are easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: A modern day set of crutches
customer_reviews.text: These crutches have little spring like things at the bottom, which is a nice feature for walking around on uneven surfaces. They have nice long under arm brace, you will want to put a towel or socks around it for comfort like any crutches and nice arm handles that curve to fit each hand specifically. I recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Jhartkopf

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I am a 70 year old plus user of crutches for most of my life. (polio at age 4 and two hip replacements) So I know of where I speak. These foldable crutches are well made and look as though they will stand-up to mega miles of use. Getting use to the design where there is a right/left crutch does pose a small challenge, but not an overwhelming problem. All in all, I am pleased with the purchase. The only reason I offered 4 stars instead of 5 was because I thought I ordered the crutches in red but instead got grey. Not a big deal, just saying.
customer_reviews.author: Russ kummer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny and stronger than they look!!
customer_reviews.text: At 6’ and 250, I was concerned these would not be sturdy enough, but My underarms were so sore from traditional crutches that I took a leap of faith and spent the money. I was very pleased with the relief I got from the friction bruising that had already built up. These crutches were extremely sturdy and placement under the arms was very comfortable. I never once felt like the crutches weren’t going to hold me and the shock absorbing tips were fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Averi Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Horrible design, second pair they sent me
customer_reviews.text: Horrible design, second pair they sent me, the handles are loose no matter how good you tighten them because the construction is faulty.. Fact!! So disappointed
customer_reviews.author: suzanne hebert

customer_reviews.title: Weak construction
customer_reviews.text: These crutches are not for big dudes. Maybe if you are in the #200 range they will work? But definitely not for the big and tall. One of them bent the first day of use. Ordered new ones thinking it was a defect, but no the new one bent the day after I received it, I’m 6’9” 340
customer_reviews.author: Dave form Elite

customer_reviews.title: If you are tall.....
customer_reviews.text: My dad is 6'8 and had surgery on his foot. The crutches available through the hospital and area medical equipment stores standard crutches go up to 6'0. We ordered these crutches and they have literally been a life saver for my dad to become mobile. They have this new age design that makes them more comfortable than the standard "old school" crutches. These crutches were worth every single penny!
customer_reviews.author: Dee R.

customer_reviews.title: Not like regular crutches
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice crutches. However, it takes some time to adjust to using them in that they are not like regular crutches. Learning to balance and move correctly takes some time and you do need some upper body strength to get around. Great product once you are accustomed to them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it....
customer_reviews.text: The crutches I was given by the hospital were causing pain in my hands and wrists. I bought these crutches and the pain went away. The crutches are made very well and I felt safer using them to get around than the hospital ones. My physical therapist was impressed with them and noted how ergonomic they seemed. They are worth the money.....
customer_reviews.author: jrn0619

customer_reviews.title: Do not get these if you are more than 260 pounds
customer_reviews.text: These crutches were great for a few weeks. Then one day i was going upstairs and one of my crutches broke in half and I become stuck on my stairs for an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Doug brenner

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but cheap parts
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the 3rd pair we’ve purchased in a year. I just brought this pair and one of the stoppers is broke. These crutches are expensive and I feel like we’re getting cheap parts. I would like replacement stoppers. My husband has to walk w/crutches everyday for the rest of his life!
customer_reviews.author: leona

customer_reviews.title: Great crutches
customer_reviews.text: At 53 years old I had to use crutches for the first time. The crutches are great the have a spring action at the bottom and the hand grip is great too. Will recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with Millennial crutches
customer_reviews.text: These crutches are ergonomic and easier to use and more portable than standard crutches. They fold easily for storage in car or airline cabin. I used them for 2 weeks following a knee replacement and will be using them again after surgery on the other knee. Crutches arrived within 2 days of placing the order.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Tsuji

customer_reviews.title: Everyone asks where we got them!
customer_reviews.text: Made for 6 foot + and up to 500 pounds = durable! My husband used these after his knee replacement. So much better and easier to use than traditional crutches. They did not hurt under his arms and he felt stable. Did I mention they have shock absorbers?
customer_reviews.author: H and S

customer_reviews.title: A Blessing for Mobility
customer_reviews.text: These crutches are helping me be more mobile with my POTS disorder. I need them for balance and have been so impressed. A life changer for me.
customer_reviews.author: Hipp P. Catmom

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and better than regular crutches!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have use many crutches over the years and was a bit skeptical about the type and price, but I figured if i'm using crutches why not try it. Well I e=was very surprised with the support they give and ease of balance when walking and no shock in the under arm area of the body. These have a great support and are unlike the regular type crutches that cause balance and body position issues, much better ergonomics and comfort to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable and hard to collapse
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for comfort and for collapsing. The handle is scratchy, and collapsing is more difficult than my current cane.
customer_reviews.author: alaron

customer_reviews.title: If you'll be on crutches for a prolonged period of time, do yourself a favor and get these
customer_reviews.text: Torn ACL and MCL 1st of January + Surgery last day of March = Extended immobility. I used the Civil War design, standard-issue crutches for about a week before someone recommended these. Night and day comparison. So glad I got them. I might call this company for a job because I've recommended them so much.
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I love these things. The shocks help out and they are comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Keola

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable...
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great set of crutches. I picked these up b/c I'll be on crutches for approx 10 weeks and the regular crutches from the ER weren't cutting it at all. The In Motion Pro crutches are more comfortable, especially on your hands and wrists with the Pro's fitted handle. The spring action takes a bit to get used to, but is a nice addition/feature if you need to be on the crutches for an extended time period. Overall, a very good product for a great price and easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: g8tr21

customer_reviews.title: Great crutches
customer_reviews.text: I use these constantly because of chronic arthritis. VERY COMFORTABLE. Hand grips, just fits well. The innovation of springs at the botton is great. They are shock absorbers that save all the upper body joints involved. Well worth the money expecially if long term use.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara L

customer_reviews.title: Work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: They work as advertised. Because each crutch is hand specific, I put a wide piece of tape on the right hand crutch so it was easier to grab the correct crutch. Con: One issue I have is using the crutches on steps; the springs don't always compress evenly, so you have to concentrate on your balance.
customer_reviews.author: KR

customer_reviews.title: Very squeaky and loud
customer_reviews.text: The hook arm rests come in handy, but these are extremely loud and annoying to use. The springs in the bottom are very squeaky, which bothers everybody at work and at home. It wakes up my kids when I go past their doors. I’ve sprayed WD40 in the springs which does not help.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan McCoy

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: they are kinda noisy but other than that work great very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Travis Cogswell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Great concept! My 6’ son with a full leg braces uses them every day. Big improvement over basic crutches.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Well made & comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, take a beating. Much more comfortable than standard crutches.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So much better than regular crutches! The hand grips are the best!
customer_reviews.author: C. Rich

customer_reviews.title: Great long term crutches
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty awesome. Comfortable, sturdy, relatively light. The only thing keeping me from giving 5 stars is the springs can be a bit noisy. If you're going to be on crutches more than a week, these are well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Handle unstable
customer_reviews.text: The handle moves around no matter how tight you turn the hardware. Will be returning yeh crutches for that reason
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Great with a Fault
customer_reviews.text: I'm really impressed with these; however, I'm bothered by the spring assembly. The strength and capability of the crutch is over shadowed by the metal on metal grinding that occurs in the spring assembly with each step. Thinking about returning.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: These were amazing! Anyone in need of prolonged use of crutches should invest in these! They helped my 22 yr old who could not weight bear for almost 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These made getting around after knee surgery so much better than normal crutches
customer_reviews.text: These made getting around after knee surgery so much better than normal crutches. Also I gave them away to a teen working at the YMCA that had sprained his foot earlier this year so I'm sure that these will get repurposed over and over to people.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t order for overnight delivery; it won’t happen. 3 days minimum.
customer_reviews.text: Good crutches, hard on your hands. I’m struggling because my hands were injured along with my knee, but if wounds weren’t on my hands it would be perfect. No padding in the hand grips which would make this better. Also bottom pegs are spring loaded.
customer_reviews.author: Robust Assassin

customer_reviews.title: Best crutches I've ever had!
customer_reviews.text: These are high-tech crutches; the arm supports distribute the pressure to offer plenty of support. The shock absorption takes the stress off my legs. The hook design is handy, I use it to hang them on things when I need a free hand or to grab something across the room. All of the padding is water resistant, so mine go into the shower daily to stay clean. They break down, so transporting them in the trunk is easy. The red color is stylish. Love, love, love 'em.
customer_reviews.author: Souixa

customer_reviews.title: Better than standard crutches
customer_reviews.text: Much better than standard crutches, especially if you have large hands or wrist problems. The handles force your wrist into a neutral position, and the springs absorb the shock. Unfortunately, the handles also are hard and rub, so they made my the skin on my hands sensitive until I developed some calluses to accommodate the rubbing. After they were great. Plus the crutches collapse, which was very helpful on a plane trip.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Check height adjustment
customer_reviews.text: I am 5 10” have to use at lowest setting
customer_reviews.author: Griz

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these crutches and get compliments all the time. No more sore hands or arm pits! Just great!
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Ehrgott

customer_reviews.title: Best Crutches Ever
customer_reviews.text: I am 6ft 4 in and had trouble with the regular hospital crutches because of my height and big hands. If you are gonna be on crutches for an extended period of time these are worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Walking with confidence
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the wait. Innovative design. Comfortable, allows me to walk for long distances with improved gait. My therapy team was excited to see them and to view the science behind development. Recommend for anyone who wants to face recovery with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn O.

customer_reviews.title: These are a life saver for my back and easily fold up for when I sit at booths or ...
customer_reviews.text: Recovering from a catastrophic knee injury everything in there had to be cut away or replaced. These are a life saver for my back and easily fold up for when I sit at booths or driving in the car. Definitely worth the money. Modified them with a cup holder.... Perfect
customer_reviews.author: Jason Moore

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: At 6'6" and 300lbs these are terrific. The pogo stick shock absorbers is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerRev. Pamela Ash

customer_reviews.title: Ease of Use
customer_reviews.text: Liked they we're easy to use and they are fold-able for ease of storage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... much easier than conventional crutches- the springy tips are great!
customer_reviews.text: So much easier than conventional crutches- the springy tips are great!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: These were average crutches to use... not all that much better than typical crutches. The glue came apart from the handle grips about 4 weeks into use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Burgin

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable. Ergo design id great. The only minus is the hand grips don't stay tight. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The shoulder rests are more comfortable than the wood crutch rests
customer_reviews.text: These crutches have shock absorbers that lessen the impact on the shoulders. The shoulder rests are more comfortable than the wood crutch rests, but the crutch itself is a little heavier than the wood. You have to get use to the handles only working on one side due to the comfortable design of the grip. A little larger pad on the should area would make it perfect!
customer_reviews.author: RPD

customer_reviews.title: much better
customer_reviews.text: these crutches dont just look cool.. they are very functional as well.. just went to walmart and got the electric cart.. they folded and fit right in the basket.. very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: millhouse

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my father, he's 6'2" about 230 lbs. They are very sturdy, comfortable, and they have a bounce to them which helps him. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: umm...yea

customer_reviews.title: Millenia Crutches
customer_reviews.text: After tearing my ACL and meniscus, I was in an immobilizer and needed some way to keep the weight off my knee. When I saw these crutches were designed to prevent wrist injuries, I was glad to finally be able to get around without my hands falling asleep. I recommend these crutches to any patient with a foot, leg, ankle, or knee injury.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Feldwisch

customer_reviews.title: A lot more comfortable than the regular crutches and forearm crutches
customer_reviews.text: I had shoulder replacement surgery in the past. I needed crutches for my knee surgery and these crutches have shock absorbers so that your shoulders are not taking in all the weight of your body from the use of crutches. A lot more comfortable than the regular crutches and forearm crutches.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great crutches. I am on them long term and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great crutches. I am on them long term and they are very useful. The ability to fold them up is awesome. The only minor flaw is that they could use a bit more padding for the arms. Otherwise, they are great
customer_reviews.author: mike saack

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these crutches about 10 days ago and they work very well. I will be using them for at least another 7 weeks. I really like the fact that they fold up and the spring action makes walking easier. I had a small problem with them and I called the company and they were very nice and send out the new part in only a couple days. I highly recommend these cruthches.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lindley

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased with my new crutches
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with my new crutches, and the awesome experience from millennial medical. Keep up the great work. I look forward to doing business with your establishment again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: foldable IN-MOTION Pro Millenial Crutches
customer_reviews.text: MUCH easier to use than regular crutches. Height adjustable, and the spring assist feature, prevents jarring, if you mistake your landing. Fold over to half their size, so easier to stow, if you need to.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gerard

customer_reviews.title: Great crutch
customer_reviews.text: Love it, was a bit scratched when I received it but still great.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Mack

customer_reviews.title: millennial crutches
customer_reviews.text: These crutches were lightweight and wonderful since they took the pressure off the area under your arms and more comfortable to hold onto. It made things easier to navigate. The only drawback was it was very difficult to wear a backpack but I found ways around that.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff

customer_reviews.title: These crutches are so awesome! They are so much easier on my wrists ...
customer_reviews.text: These crutches are so awesome! They are so much easier on my wrists and shoulders. I ordered direct from the manufacturer because I needed to use my Flex Spending Account debit card. They would not honor it's use from Amazon. However the shipping made it to my home in record time (next day). At 350lbs I needed the benefit these crutches provide,. My post op mobility had been greatly enhance. I will never go back if I ever have to use crutches this is my preferred product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Miracle
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for at lease 15+ years non stop. I actually have two sets, one that just stays in my SUV always. and then newer set is for the house going out for anything pair. I will never use any other type or brand again.
customer_reviews.author: puggsie's mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Crutches/Great Company!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome crutches! I needed these for a severely sprained ankle. Being 6'10", it was impossible to find crutches tall enough at my local pharmacy. I needed these for a trip to NYC for Christmas. I needed them overnighted, so I googled Millennial Medical and gave them a call. I was able to talk to someone and get the crutches delivered overnight. Millennial Medical covered the difference in shipping. Great company and great crutches. I would definitely recommend them to anyone who is looking for crutches that are comfortable, durable, and easy to travel with.
customer_reviews.author: David Ivey

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Innovation
customer_reviews.text: I ruptured my left Achilles tendon a couple of years ago. I used the Millennial Crutch in transitioning from a leg caddy...non-weight bearing phase of my recovery...they allowed a much greater sense of mobility and stability then regular crutches. I live and work in a area with a lot of hills and stairs. The spring mechanism, grips, and under arm support really helped when planting and lifting off the ground. They also help me transition to the walking phase of my recovery, once I was in walking cast. Being dependent on crutches for mobility is mentally taxing and the Millennial Crutch really helped me physically and psychologically...
customer_reviews.author: Julien Rust

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate. Best crutch on the planet.
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about these crutches. I brought these to use post-surgery and every nurse tried them out. I would buy them again just for the springs, but the ergonomic handles and the underarm support are a bonus. Healing from a surgery is hard enough work. Why suffer with the hideous hospital crutches, stuffing rags under your armpits?
customer_reviews.author: Climberkate

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy and a long stride
customer_reviews.text: Super sturdy therefore heavier than std crutches. These do give a longer stride. However due to the nature of my injury I did not get out to use them more than 3 times. I feel they are superior and a good value for people who are on crutches more than a few times. I think more could be done to make the underarm portion more comfortable for small shouldered women like me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have found these crutches to work very well. They are more comfortable than standard crutches. The springs reduce the shock on your wrists and the angle of the hand grips is more comfortable as well. So far they have stood up with no breakage. The only problem I have encountered is that the ergonomically designed grips can cause blisters on the heel of your palm if you have to use them for a continuous, extended period of time. Otherwise, they have been great.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Fournie

customer_reviews.title: Millennial crutch
customer_reviews.text: What a great product. These are much better than my old pair of standard crutches I have been using. I have been on crutches for 5 years due to an permanent injury sustained in a head on car collision. My left hip is partially fused and my left leg is approx 3 in shorter than my right. These crutches are so comfortable and convenient to use. I especially enjoy the shock absorbers on the bottom of these crutches. Much better feel when using these crutches I cannot say enough good things about them. They are definetly worth the price difference over the cost of a standard pair of cruches.
customer_reviews.author: D. H. Chang

customer_reviews.title: In motion pro crutch
customer_reviews.text: I just received these sticks and are by far the best I have used. I wish I could have had a pair when I had my ACL repaired. Now that I am on crutches again for achilles surgery i didn't hesitate to purchase these. I give these 5 stars from the arm rests, spring loaded, foldable, to the grips. My 1 complaint is the handles get slippery if you have sweaty hands so be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. they are so much easier to use than the common crutch and you don't have the added stress on your wrists and shoulders when using this versus a regular crutch.
customer_reviews.author: puggsie's mom

customer_reviews.title: Millenial Travel Crutches
customer_reviews.text: I drive a small car with a small trunk. It happens to be a 2 seater so space is a premium. These crutches fold nicely and fit very well in my trunk so I can have a passenger. I rate these babies 5 stars, and the service I got was great, good communication and package arrived timely and undamaged. Would recommend both the crutches and Millenial.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Parenteau

customer_reviews.title: Best option for me
customer_reviews.text: great product. Little heavy but comfort in the handles off sets the weight. Can also be a bit noisy in the spring area. That said, they are far better than regular crutches
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good crutch for long-time users
customer_reviews.text: This is a good crutch for permanent or long-time users. These really relieve the stress on your elbows and shoulders. My only complaint is the handgrips loosen up and tend to strip out( I had to order new grips). Also, the tips wear out very quickly on a rough surface such as gravel and asphalt.
customer_reviews.author: B. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great crutch and very comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.text: I used the old style crutches for 2 days and loved getting rid of them and going to these. Hopefully, I won't need them in the future, but will use these, if the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great new product!
customer_reviews.text: The millennial crutch is a great new design on the old standard wooden crutches. The spring action and curved design of the crutches won't jam your underarms.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle A. Mcdowell

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product have not had the trouble that some people have with the handles. Have been useing them for 4 weeks now and 4 more to go way better then the standard crutch.
customer_reviews.author: mikey08

customer_reviews.title: Awesome crutches
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband in 2012 as he has scoliosis and a bad hip. He has used them every day since. I finally bought a new pair for a spare. The first pair still work great however i wanted to give him a spare. He said the new pair is lighter and he likes that.
customer_reviews.author: sandig50

customer_reviews.title: Would be cool if the sizing was right
customer_reviews.text: The sizing is off. Go for shorter and be prepared to modify the arms because these are HARD. Beyond that the suspension is a nice touch but the extra tall says it is for 5’10” to 7’2”. Wrong. Unless you are no less than 6’3” these are going to be too tall on the lowest setting. The next size down is too short on the highest setting. He is 6’1” so should be well in the recommended height for either...but neither works quite right. If the xl had one more notch to move down it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jessawampak

customer_reviews.title: Rubber tips break....a lot
customer_reviews.text: The crutches are super comfortable and easy to use. They get kind of squeaky and loud which I really don’t care about but my biggest complaint is that the rubber tips on mine break and tear really easily. I’ve been using them for about 5 weeks and I’ve had to replace three tips already. You can get extra tips but they cost around $10 dollars and then shipping is another $10 dollars. If it wasn’t for the tips crapping out so often, this would definitely be a 5 star review
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: the handles are pretty hard so not super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'8" and right below knee amputee. I keep these in my trunk if needed. They collapse well and are very well built. Only issues are the spring loaded ends are kinda noisy if you are going around the house. Also, the handles are pretty hard so not super comfortable. Otherwise they are really sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Better than regular crutches
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for crutches in my local medical supply store but found my wrist hurt with each one I tried. The rep suggested these crutches and after researching and reading other reviews, I decided to order them. I'm so glad I did; they definitely take the pressure off my wrist. If you experience chronic wrist pain, these are your best choice.
customer_reviews.author: GmaDebz

customer_reviews.title: SO COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: I've been on crutches for 2 months, waiting for ACL reconstruction which is still a month away. Using "standard" crutches would cause my lower back to give out. A friend who is an orthopaedic surgeon recommended these. Took me 10 minutes to assemble and adjust to my height (5'10) and arm length. Very comfortable but took using them 30 minutes to get the feel for them. No lower back pain. Very happy
customer_reviews.author: KMS

customer_reviews.title: works great. Have an issue with on leg spring and ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are 5'7" you should let them know and they will special design them for you. Long was too tall and short didn't give me any extra length if I needed it. They changed out the 2 sizes and used short on top and long on the legs, works great. Have an issue with on leg spring and they are replacing that piece. They are nice to work with. Called the company and worked through them on warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Teri Henderson

customer_reviews.title: I love these crutches
customer_reviews.text: I love these crutches. The spring tips are quiet and my office mates say they can't hear me coming anymore. The handles are super comfortable and I'm standing upright. The only thing I'm upset about is the color. I was told they were fire engine red but as you can tell from the picture they are actually maroon. That is why I gave 4 stars instead of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Professional Counselor

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy for crutches. The springs are very hard to get used to and they really hurt my armpits after extended use.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Good for About 10days
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable for about 10days then the spring started getting weaker and weaker. Spring started squeaking like others have mentioned. Would expect better for $140 crunches. Still better than normal crunches
customer_reviews.author: Carmelo C.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.  Except for rubber feet.
customer_reviews.text: Very stable for large users. Far better than conventional crutches. However the runner “feet” are inferior. I’ve had to buy multiple extras and they keep ripping open. Then the crutch is slippery and dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Henkel

customer_reviews.title: Cool Crutches
customer_reviews.text: Really counting on these to keep me mobile after foot surgery. They do still hurt my underarms so may need some extra padding. One right crutch spring is not a compressible as the left so not sure how that will work out when I am using them all the time. Surgery is tomorrow. One thing to know - I am 5'5' (barely) and I am at the highest notch on the crutches. If you are 5'6" you will need the larger size (not the short ones).
customer_reviews.author: WA

customer_reviews.title: Support for extra tall people.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: they were tall enough. Pro: they supported 336 lbs. Con: they aren’t very sturdy. The end caps took a beating.
customer_reviews.author: Daizylady

customer_reviews.title: Great if you are taller. Could use shorter version.
customer_reviews.text: I love these crutches but they would be much better if I could adjust them 1 to 2 inches shorter.
customer_reviews.author: BIGBUYER

customer_reviews.title: Best choice
customer_reviews.text: These work very well after a couple of days practice. Easy to adjust and as comfortable as crutches can be,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I like the easy set up and use of these crutches
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good strong Crutches
customer_reviews.text: Good strong Crutches. I definately recommend them for people with back pain (or foot problems/ orthopedic problems). They were recommended by my Physical Therapist.
customer_reviews.author: John R

customer_reviews.title: It looks pretty with a lot of thought in the design
customer_reviews.text: Too heavy. I think it's three times as heavy as standard hospital crutches. It looks pretty with a lot of thought in the design. But, because of the weight, it slows me down and wear me out. I think it would be okay for someone physically strong with just a broken foot.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Chang

product_meta.title: in-Motion Pro Crutches | Foldable | Ergonomic Handles | Spring Assist Technology | Articulating Tips | Size Tall (5'7" - 6'10") | Charcoal Grey
feature_bullets: DURABLE FOLDING PORTABLE CRUTCHES: The newly re-designed cylinder bracket and double reinforced strut ensure the product’s strength and durability throughout the handle of the crutch. Our In-Motion Pro Ergonomic Folding Crutches can be stored conveniently and carried for travel. The heavy-duty construction has a user capacity of 500 lbs.

ERGONOMIC HAND GRIPS SET: The ergonomic positioning and design of the grips keep hands and wrists in their natural position, eliminating wrist pain and nerve damage. The unique folding feature allows users to quickly circulate their crutches in and out of use without changing any height adjustments. This makes the In-Motion Pro the most convenient crutch to travel with, store, and ship.

SPRING-ASSISTED ARM CRUTCHES: The Spring Assist Technology absorbs the impact from walking and uses that energy to aid patient movement. Our Spring Assist Technology makes our springs quieter than traditional crutch springs and our foam rubber padding helps reduce friction and divert pressure from each underarm.

ARTICULATING CRUTCH TIPS: Our Sure Foot Articulating Tips give greater stability on uneven surfaces and unstable ground. They are excellent on solid, indoor surfaces such as hardwood floors or carpet, and are great on outdoor surfaces such as grass, gravel, and dirt. Our crutch tips also give the user extra maneuverability.

GREAT FOR POSTURE: In addition to added comfort on the wrists and shoulders, our highly adjustable, ergonomic design allows for users to naturally walk more erect, which is normally a challenge for most conventional crutch users, thus making them essential for a proper and speedy recovery. They are highly recommended for patients undergoing physical therapy.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
